member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrl.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a file handler virtual path to a friendly URL using the registered resolvers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrl.Segments
member.summary: The URL segments left over after Friendly URLs mapped this request to a file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrlSettings
member.summary: Represents the settings used when enabling Friendly URLs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrlSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the FriendlyUrlSettings class with the default values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrlSettings.AutoRedirectMode
member.summary: The type of redirect to perform on non-friendly URLs to friendly URLs. Defaults to Off.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrlSettings.ResolverCachingMode
member.summary: The mode of caching to use when resolving friendly URLs. Defaults to ResolverCachingMode.Static.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrlSettings.SwitchViewRouteName
member.summary: The name of the route that handles user requests to switch views. Defaults to "AspNet.FriendlyUrls.SwitchView".

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrlSettings.SwitchViewUrl
member.summary: The URL that view switching request are sent to. Defaults to "__FriendlyUrls_SwitchView/{view}".

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.HttpRequestExtensions.GetFriendlyUrlFileExtension(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Returns the extension of the file Friendly URLs mapped this request to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.HttpRequestExtensions.GetFriendlyUrlFileExtension(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Returns the extension of the file Friendly URLs mapped this request to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.HttpRequestExtensions.GetFriendlyUrlFileVirtualPath(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Returns the virtual path of the file Friendly URLs mapped this request to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.HttpRequestExtensions.GetFriendlyUrlFileVirtualPath(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Returns the virtual path of the file Friendly URLs mapped this request to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.HttpRequestExtensions.GetFriendlyUrlSegments(System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Returns the URL segments left over after Friendly URLs mapped this request to a file.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.HttpRequestExtensions.GetFriendlyUrlSegments(System.Web.HttpRequestBase)
member.summary: Returns the URL segments left over after the current request has been mapped to a file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.RedirectMode
member.summary: Represents the mode of redirect to use when auto-redirecting to friendly URLs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.RedirectMode.Permanent
member.summary: Performs a permanent redirect (301 response code).

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.RedirectMode.Temporary
member.summary: Performs a temporary redirect (302 response code).

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.RedirectMode.Off
member.summary: Performs no auto-redirect (disabled).

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.ResolverCachingMode
member.summary: Represents the mode of caching to use when resolving URLs. This setting affects how quickly extension-less URLs can be mapped back to their corresponding full URLs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.ResolverCachingMode.Static
member.summary: Build a list of files at application startup. This mode of operation is appropriate for sites where files are not added or removed at runtime.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.ResolverCachingMode.Dynamic
member.summary: Builds a list of files as requests arrive, and updates the file list as files in the site change. This mode of operation uses more memory than a static cache, but is useful for updating the file list for sites where files or directories are added or removed at runtime.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.ResolverCachingMode.Disabled
member.summary: Don't perform any caching. Always query the file system directly every time a request to a friendly URL comes in.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.RouteCollectionExtensions.EnableFriendlyUrls(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection)
member.summary: Enables friendly URLs for Web Forms pages.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.RouteCollectionExtensions.EnableFriendlyUrls(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection,Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrlSettings)
member.summary: Enables friendly URLs for Web Forms pages.
member.param: The settings to use when enabling Friendly Urls.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.RouteCollectionExtensions.EnableFriendlyUrls(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection,Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.FriendlyUrlSettings,Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.IFriendlyUrlResolver[])
member.summary: Enables friendly URLs using the passed resolvers.
member.param: The settings to use when enabling Friendly Urls.
The friendly URL resolvers to use.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.RouteCollectionExtensions.EnableFriendlyUrls(System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection,Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.IFriendlyUrlResolver[])
member.summary: Enables friendly URLs using the specified resolvers.
member.param: The friendly URL resolvers to use.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.ModelBinding.FriendlyUrlSegmentsAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that specifies that model binding values are provided by a friendly URL segment.

member.summary: Creates an instance of the FriendlyUrlSegmentsAttribute class.
member.param: The index of the URL segment to return.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.ModelBinding.FriendlyUrlSegmentsValueProvider
member.summary: A value provider that retrieves values from the segments of a Friendly URL.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.FriendlyUrlResolver
member.summary: Resolves a friendly URL to an HTTP handler.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.FriendlyUrlResolver.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a FriendlyUrlResolver for the provided extension.
member.param: The physical file extension understood by this resolver. Must include the leading period, e.g. ".aspx".

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.FriendlyUrlResolver.ConvertToFriendlyUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a typical URL with a file extension into a friendly extension-less URL.
member.returns: The friendly URL (extension stripped) if this resolver can automatically map extensionless URLs to physical files with the provided extension. Otherwise, null.
member.param: The original path, including the file extension.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.FriendlyUrlResolver.GetExtensions(System.Web.HttpContextBase)
member.summary: Gets the extensions to use (such as .aspx, .ashx, or .mobile.aspx) while attempting to resolve an HTTP handler from the friendly URL.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.FriendlyUrlResolver.PreprocessRequest(System.Web.HttpContextBase,System.Web.IHttpHandler)
member.summary: Called after a friendly URL is resolved to an HTTP handler but before the handler is executed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.GenericHandlerFriendlyUrlResolver
member.summary: Resolves friendly URLs to generic handlers such as *.ashx.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.IFriendlyUrlResolver.ConvertToFriendlyUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a typical URL with a file extension into a friendly extension-less URL.
member.returns: The friendly extension-less URL if this resolver can automaticallymap extensionless URLs to physical files with the provided extension. Otherwise, null.
member.param: The original path, including the file extension.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.IFriendlyUrlResolver.GetExtensions(System.Web.HttpContextBase)
member.summary: Returns a list of file extensions that the Friendly URLs system will try to resolve for the current request. For example, if the current request is for "~/example" and the GetExtensions method returns [ ".mobile.aspx", ".aspx", ".en-us.aspx" ], then the Friendly URLs system will attempt to match the current request to thefiles "~/example.mobile.aspx", "~/example.aspx", and "~/example.en-us.aspx", returning the first match.
member.returns: A list of extensions that the system should try to resolve.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.IFriendlyUrlResolver.PreprocessRequest(System.Web.HttpContextBase,System.Web.IHttpHandler)
member.summary: Provides the ability to inspect or modify the IHttpHandler that was resolved for the current request before the handler's ProcessRequest method is called.
member.param: The handler that will be invoked.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.WebFormsFriendlyUrlResolver
member.summary: Resolves friendly URLs to Web Forms pages.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.WebFormsFriendlyUrlResolver.IsMobileView(System.Web.HttpContextBase)
member.summary: Determines if the current friendly URL was resolved to a mobile view based on the client browser and/or overrides.
member.returns: Whether the current view is a mobile view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.WebFormsFriendlyUrlResolver.TrySetMasterPageFile(System.Web.UI.Page,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to set the MasterPageFile property for the given page based on whether the master page exists.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the master page was set.
member.param: The master page file virtual path.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.FriendlyUrls.Resolvers.WebFormsFriendlyUrlResolver.TrySetMobileMasterPage(System.Web.HttpContextBase,System.Web.UI.Page,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to set the MasterPageFile property for the given page to a mobile specific master page.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the master page was set.
